= Introduction =

MarMoT is a generic [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conditional_random_field Conditional Random Field] (CRF) framework as well as a state-of-the-art morphological tagger. The latest version can be downloaded [http://goo.gl/L2JVgz here].

= Quickstart =

The most typical thing to do with MarMoT is to annotate words with their morphological properties. 

Given a file text.txt in a one-word-per-line format:
<pre>
Murmeltiere
sind
im
Hochgebirge
zu
Hause
.
</pre>

The following command:
<pre>
java -cp marmot.jar marmot.morph.cmd.Annotator\
 --model-file de.marmot\
 --test-file form-index=0,text.txt\
 --pred-file text.out.txt\
</pre>

Will produce a file in (a truncated) [http://ufal.mff.cuni.cz/conll2009-st/task-description.html CoNLL09] format:

<pre>
0       Murmeltiere     _       _       _       NN      _       case=nom|number=pl|gender=masc
1       sind            _       _       _       VAFIN   _       number=pl|person=3|tense=pres|mood=ind
2       im              _       _       _       APPRART _       case=dat|number=sg|gender=neut
3       Hochgebirge     _       _       _       NN      _       case=dat|number=sg|gender=neut
4       zu              _       _       _       APPR    _       _ 
5       Hause           _       _       _       NN      _       case=dat|number=sg|gender=neut
6       .               _       _       _       $.      _       _
</pre>

The actual tags will depend on the annotation of the treebank that was used to train the MarMoT model. The tags here are in the [https://catalog.clarin.eu/isocat/rest/dcs/376 STTS] format used by [http://www.ims.uni-stuttgart.de/forschung/ressourcen/korpora/tiger.html TIGER].
